titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1607_05
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1607_05

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

div.tei:ab:
Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.[.]dʿʾb | ḏbyn | bn | šhr | mlk | qtbn | w-qtbn | (m) 2. | w-rdmn | w-ʾlmlk | w-mḍḥym | w-yḥr | w-bklm 3.w-bklnhn | w-kl | ʾšʿbm | ymlk | ydʿʾb | bn | mʾtmm | 4. | bn | qtbn | w-ḏtn | ʾšʿbn | w-l | yḥrm | sw[... ...] 5. | b-yṯfṭ-s | w-sḥr | w-sʿbr | w-ṣry | mlkn | bn | t 6.ṯm | w-mʿb[... ... ... ...] 7.[... ... ... ...]ʾnsn [... ... ... ...]
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[... ... | w-sḥr | y]dʿʾb | ḏbyn | bn | šhr | mlk | qtbn | w-qtbn | (m)[śwdn] 2.[w-fqḍtn | w-btln] | w-rdmn | w-ʾlmlk | w-mḍḥym | w-yḥr | w-bklm[y-w-ḏ-... ...] 3.[... ...tn |] w-bklnhn | w-kl | ʾšʿbm | ymlk | ydʿʾb | bn | mʾtmm | [w-ʾmm |] 4.[... ...m | ʾḫ-s] | bn | qtbn | w-ḏtn | ʾšʿbn | w-l | yḥrm | sw [| ʾnsn | hrgn |] 5.[... ...knm] | b-yṯfṭ-s | w-sḥr | w-sʿbr | w-ṣry | mlkn | bn | t[mnʿ | w-] 6.[... ...kr | br]ṯm | w-mʿb[rm | ġyr | brṯm | b-ysḥr-s | w-sʿbr | w-ṣry | m=] 7.[lkn | ... ...l-ymt | sw |] ʾnsn [| mstʿdwn | knm | b-ykśʾ | w-ḥlt | nfs-s] 8.[... ...gs | mwt | ʾw | mʿbr | b-nfs | mstʿdwn | ʾsmʿm] 9.[... ... wrḫ-s | ḏ-mslʿt | ḫrf | ġwṯʾl ḏ-ġ=] 10.[... ...f | hgrn | tmnʿ | w-wʿln | w-śyrm | w-] 11.[... ...ṯfṭ | w-ḥrg | mlkn | bn | hgr | ʾšʿb | ʿm | w-ḏm | b-yhrg | f-l |] 12.[... ...ʾrḍm | b-s | b-yhrg | nḥql | bn | ʾrbʿ | ywmytm | n-l | yntwḥ | ʿd |] 13.[... ...mʿbrn | ʿd-km | b-yṣry-s | mlkn | knm | b-yʿbr | w-ḥwr | w-tʿlm-ʾy | y=] 14.[d | šhr | w-tʿlm-ʾy | ʾydw | zydm | ḏ-ẓrb | ḏ-ḏrʾn | w-šhrm | d-ḏrʾn | w-ṣbḥkrb | ḏ-hrn |] 15.[... ...mškrm | ḏ-ġrbm | w-ḏrʾkrb | bn | ḥnẓt | w-gyrm | ḏ-šhr | w-hwfʿm | bn] 16.[... ... | ḏ-ygr | w-ʿmyṯʿ | ḏ-ršm | w-lḥyʿṯt | mʿhr | w-ḍbʾm | bn | zḫnn | w-hwfʿṯt | n=] 17.[... ... bn | mʿhr | w-ʾbšbm | bn | ʾʿsyfr | w-ḏydm | ġrbn | w-ʿmḏḫr | glgln | w-hwtrʿṯt] 18.[... ...hwfʿm | ḏ-hṣbḥ | w-ʿmḏḫr | ḏ-šrgn | w-ʾbšfq | ḏ-hrmw | w-ʾbšfq | bn | gʾnn | w-lśb] 19.[... ... | w-yṯʿkrb | yʾḏn | w-nbṭʿly | bn | hṯb | ršḥm | w-ʿmkrb | bn | ṣbḥm | w-smydʿ | ḏ-gʿrn] 20.[... ...šfq | ḏ-yfʿm | w-mʿdʾl | ḏ-nḍrn | w-nbṭʿm | bn | ṭwyn | w-yʿgf | ḏ-yʿgf | w-ḏydm | ḏ-ʿgḏ | w-ʿ=] 21.[... ... ḏ-hṯʿr | lḥy | w-ʿmʾmn | ḫbḏn | w-smydʿ | ṭn.zm | w-ynfʾ | ḏ-rft | w-nbṭʿm | ḏ-ḏrḥn]

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.[Ya]daʿʾab Dhubyān bin Shahr, King of Qatabān, and the Qatabānian people: [.] 2.and Radmān and ʾĪlmalak and Maḍḥayyum and Yaḥirr and Baklama[.] 3.and Bakīlānhān and all of the (other) tribes over which Yadaʿʾab rules, in unison 4.from Qatabān and these tribes, let that [... ...] be anathematized 5.[... ...] the king judges it and ordains and examines and declares from [.] 6.[... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...]] 7.[... ... ... ...] individual [... ... ... ...]
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[... ... and ordained Ya]daʿʾab Dhubyān bin Shahr, King of Qatabān, and the Qatabānian people: [ the council] 2.[and (the tribes of) Faqḍatān and Batlān] and Radmān and ʾĪlmalak and Maḍḥayyum and Yaḥirr and Baklama[y and Dhū-Th... …] 3.[... ...] and Bakīlānhān and all of the (other) tribes over which Yadaʿʾab rules, in unison [and as a group,] 4.[... ... his fellow tribesman] from Qatabān and these tribes, let that [individual who has killed] be anathematized 5.[... ...] the king judges it and ordains and examines and declares from [Tamnaʿ and] 6.[... ... on the spot and an examination in absentia, which the king decrees and examines and declares] 7.[... ... let that] individual [die who commits an offense against this which has been settled, for his life is forfeit] 8.[... ... death or examination (regarding) the life of the one who commits an offense. The witnesses] 9.[... ... the month of Masaʿlāt of the year of Ghawthʾīl Dhū-Gh=] 10.[... ... the town of Tamnaʿ and Waʿlān and Śayrum and] 11.[... ... the king … judges and decrees from the town of the tribes of ʿAmm. And whoever kills, let] 12.[... ... a land in which he kills, specifically within four days, then let them mourn until] 13.[... ... the examination until such time as the king declares, so shall he examine and promulgate. And Shahr has signed (this) in his own] 14.[hand. And (so too) have signed in their own hands Zaydum Dhū-Ẓarib Dhū-Dharaʾān and Shahrum Dhū-Dharaʾān and Ṣabaḥkarib Dhū-Hirrān] 15.[... ... Mashkarum Dhū-Gharībam and Dharaʾkarib bin Ḥanẓat and Gayrum Dhū-Shahr and Hawfāʿamm bin] 16.[... ... Dhū-Yagirr and ʿAmmīyathaʿ Dhū-Rashīm and Laḥayʿathat Maʿāhir and Ḍabʾum bin Zikhnān and Hawfāʿathat N=] 17.[... ... bin Maʿāhir and ʾAbīshibām bin ʾAʿsāyfir and Dhaydum Gharībān and ʿAmmīdhakhar Gulgulān and Hawtarʿathat] 18.[... ... Hawfāʿamm Dhū-Haṣbaḥ and ʿAmmīdhakhar Dhū-Shirgān and ʾAbīshafaq Dhū-Harmaw and ʾAbīshafaq bin Giʾnān and Laśib] 19.[... ... and Yithāʿkarib Yiʾdhān and Nabaṭʿalī bin Hathib Rishḥum and ʿAmmīkarib bin Ṣabāḥum and Sumūyadaʿ Dhū-Guʿrān] 20.[... ...shafaq Dhū-Yāfiʿam and Maʿdʾīl Dhū-Naḍīrān and Nabaṭʿamm bin Ṭawiyyān and Yaʿgif Dhū-Yaʿgif and Dhaydum Dhū-ʿAgidh and ʿA=] 21.[... ... Dhū-Hathʿar Laḥay and ʿAmmīʾamīn Khabidhān and Sumūyadaʿ Ṭan[.]zum and Yinfaʾ Dhū-Rafit and Nabaṭʿamm Dhū-Dharaḥān.]

tei:div.tei:message: Caught error exerr:EXXQDY0002: Error parsing XML. Document is not valid. Fatal (8,216) : The element type "ab" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</ab>". Validated in -1 millisec. in document 1110003366.xml
tei:div.tei:text:
<ab type="formal-markup">Text preserved in this squeeze:
<lb n="1"/><supplied reason="lost">Ya</supplied>daʿʾab Dhubyān bin Shahr, King of Qatabān, and the Qatabānian people: <supplied reason="lost">.</supplied> <lb n="2"/>and Radmān and ʾĪlmalak and Maḍḥayyum and Yaḥirr and Baklama<supplied reason="lost">.</supplied> <lb n="3"/>and Bakīlānhān and all of the <unclear>other</unclear> tribes over which Yadaʿʾab rules, in unison <lb n="4"/>from Qatabān and these tribes, let that <supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap></supplied> be anathematized <lb n="5"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap></supplied> the king judges it and ordains and examines and declares from <supplied reason="lost">.</supplied> <lb n="6"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> <gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> <gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> <gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap></supplied></supplied> <lb n="7"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> <gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap></supplied> individual <supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> <gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap></supplied>
Restored full text of the inscription:
<lb n="1"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> and ordained Ya</supplied>daʿʾab Dhubyān bin Shahr, King of Qatabān, and the Qatabānian people: <supplied reason="lost"> the council</supplied> <lb n="2"/><supplied reason="lost">and <unclear>the tribes of</unclear> Faqḍatān and Batlān</supplied> and Radmān and ʾĪlmalak and Maḍḥayyum and Yaḥirr and Baklama<supplied reason="lost">y and Dhū-Th... …</supplied> <lb n="3"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap></supplied> and Bakīlānhān and all of the <unclear>other</unclear> tribes over which Yadaʿʾab rules, in unison <supplied reason="lost">and as a group,</supplied> <lb n="4"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> his fellow tribesman</supplied> from Qatabān and these tribes, let that <supplied reason="lost">individual who has killed</supplied> be anathematized <lb n="5"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap></supplied> the king judges it and ordains and examines and declares from <supplied reason="lost">Tamnaʿ and</supplied> <lb n="6"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> on the spot and an examination in absentia, which the king decrees and examines and declares</supplied> <lb n="7"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> let that</supplied> individual <supplied reason="lost">die who commits an offense against this which has been settled, for his life is forfeit</supplied> <lb n="8"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> death or examination <unclear>regarding</unclear> the life of the one who commits an offense. The witnesses</supplied> <lb n="9"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> the month of Masaʿlāt of the year of Ghawthʾīl Dhū-Gh=</supplied> <lb n="10"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> the town of Tamnaʿ and Waʿlān and Śayrum and</supplied> <lb n="11"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> the king … judges and decrees from the town of the tribes of ʿAmm. And whoever kills, let</supplied> <lb n="12"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> a land in which he kills, specifically within four days, then let them mourn until</supplied> <lb n="13"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> the examination until such time as the king declares, so shall he examine and promulgate. And Shahr has signed <unclear>this</unclear> in his own</supplied> <lb n="14"/><supplied reason="lost">hand. And <unclear>so too</unclear> have signed in their own hands Zaydum Dhū-Ẓarib Dhū-Dharaʾān and Shahrum Dhū-Dharaʾān and Ṣabaḥkarib Dhū-Hirrān</supplied> <lb n="15"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> Mashkarum Dhū-Gharībam and Dharaʾkarib bin Ḥanẓat and Gayrum Dhū-Shahr and Hawfāʿamm bin</supplied> <lb n="16"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> Dhū-Yagirr and ʿAmmīyathaʿ Dhū-Rashīm and Laḥayʿathat Maʿāhir and Ḍabʾum bin Zikhnān and Hawfāʿathat N=</supplied> <lb n="17"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> bin Maʿāhir and ʾAbīshibām bin ʾAʿsāyfir and Dhaydum Gharībān and ʿAmmīdhakhar Gulgulān and Hawtarʿathat</supplied> <lb n="18"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> Hawfāʿamm Dhū-Haṣbaḥ and ʿAmmīdhakhar Dhū-Shirgān and ʾAbīshafaq Dhū-Harmaw and ʾAbīshafaq bin Giʾnān and Laśib</supplied> <lb n="19"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> and Yithāʿkarib Yiʾdhān and Nabaṭʿalī bin Hathib Rishḥum and ʿAmmīkarib bin Ṣabāḥum and Sumūyadaʿ Dhū-Guʿrān</supplied> <lb n="20"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap>shafaq Dhū-Yāfiʿam and Maʿdʾīl Dhū-Naḍīrān and Nabaṭʿamm bin Ṭawiyyān and Yaʿgif Dhū-Yaʿgif and Dhaydum Dhū-ʿAgidh and ʿA=</supplied> <lb n="21"/><supplied reason="lost"><gap quantity="plus4" unit="chars"></gap> Dhū-Hathʿar Laḥay and ʿAmmīʾamīn Khabidhān and Sumūyadaʿ Ṭan<supplied reason="lost">.</supplied>zum and Yinfaʾ Dhū-Rafit and Nabaṭʿamm Dhū-Dharaḥān.</supplied></ab>

div.tei:ab:
Text preserved in this squeeze:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān bin Shahr, King of Qatabān, and the Qatabānian people: .
and Radmān and ʾĪlmalak and Maḍḥayyum and Yaḥirr and Baklama.
and Bakīlānhān and all of the other tribes over which Yadaʿʾab rules, in unison
from Qatabān and these tribes, let that be anathematized
the king judges it and ordains and examines and declares from .
individual
Restored full text of the inscription:
and ordained Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān bin Shahr, King of Qatabān, and the Qatabānian people: the council
and the tribes of Faqḍatān and Batlān and Radmān and ʾĪlmalak and Maḍḥayyum and Yaḥirr and Baklamay and Dhū-Th... …
and Bakīlānhān and all of the other tribes over which Yadaʿʾab rules, in unison and as a group,
his fellow tribesman from Qatabān and these tribes, let that individual who has killed be anathematized
the king judges it and ordains and examines and declares from Tamnaʿ and
on the spot and an examination in absentia, which the king decrees and examines and declares
let that individual die who commits an offense against this which has been settled, for his life is forfeit
death or examination regarding the life of the one who commits an offense. The witnesses
the month of Masaʿlāt of the year of Ghawthʾīl Dhū-Gh=
the town of Tamnaʿ and Waʿlān and Śayrum and
the king … judges and decrees from the town of the tribes of ʿAmm. And whoever kills, let
a land in which he kills, specifically within four days, then let them mourn until
the examination until such time as the king declares, so shall he examine and promulgate. And Shahr has signed this in his own
hand. And so too have signed in their own hands Zaydum Dhū-Ẓarib Dhū-Dharaʾān and Shahrum Dhū-Dharaʾān and Ṣabaḥkarib Dhū-Hirrān
Mashkarum Dhū-Gharībam and Dharaʾkarib bin Ḥanẓat and Gayrum Dhū-Shahr and Hawfāʿamm bin
Dhū-Yagirr and ʿAmmīyathaʿ Dhū-Rashīm and Laḥayʿathat Maʿāhir and Ḍabʾum bin Zikhnān and Hawfāʿathat N=
bin Maʿāhir and ʾAbīshibām bin ʾAʿsāyfir and Dhaydum Gharībān and ʿAmmīdhakhar Gulgulān and Hawtarʿathat
Hawfāʿamm Dhū-Haṣbaḥ and ʿAmmīdhakhar Dhū-Shirgān and ʾAbīshafaq Dhū-Harmaw and ʾAbīshafaq bin Giʾnān and Laśib
and Yithāʿkarib Yiʾdhān and Nabaṭʿalī bin Hathib Rishḥum and ʿAmmīkarib bin Ṣabāḥum and Sumūyadaʿ Dhū-Guʿrān
shafaq Dhū-Yāfiʿam and Maʿdʾīl Dhū-Naḍīrān and Nabaṭʿamm bin Ṭawiyyān and Yaʿgif Dhū-Yaʿgif and Dhaydum Dhū-ʿAgidh and ʿA=
Dhū-Hathʿar Laḥay and ʿAmmīʾamīn Khabidhān and Sumūyadaʿ Ṭan.zum and Yinfaʾ Dhū-Rafit and Nabaṭʿamm Dhū-Dharaḥān.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān bin Shahr, King of Qatabān, and the Qatabānian people: .
and Radmān and ʾĪlmalak and Maḍḥayyum and Yaḥirr and Baklama.
and Bakīlānhān and all of the other tribes over which Yadaʿʾab rules, in unison
from Qatabān and these tribes, let that be anathematized
the king judges it and ordains and examines and declares from .
individual
Restored full text of the inscription:
and ordained Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān bin Shahr, King of Qatabān, and the Qatabānian people: the council
and the tribes of Faqḍatān and Batlān and Radmān and ʾĪlmalak and Maḍḥayyum and Yaḥirr and Baklamay and Dhū-Th... …
and Bakīlānhān and all of the other tribes over which Yadaʿʾab rules, in unison and as a group,
his fellow tribesman from Qatabān and these tribes, let that individual who has killed be anathematized
the king judges it and ordains and examines and declares from Tamnaʿ and
on the spot and an examination in absentia, which the king decrees and examines and declares
let that individual die who commits an offense against this which has been settled, for his life is forfeit
death or examination regarding the life of the one who commits an offense. The witnesses
the month of Masaʿlāt of the year of Ghawthʾīl Dhū-Gh=
the town of Tamnaʿ and Waʿlān and Śayrum and
the king … judges and decrees from the town of the tribes of ʿAmm. And whoever kills, let
a land in which he kills, specifically within four days, then let them mourn until
the examination until such time as the king declares, so shall he examine and promulgate. And Shahr has signed this in his own
hand. And so too have signed in their own hands Zaydum Dhū-Ẓarib Dhū-Dharaʾān and Shahrum Dhū-Dharaʾān and Ṣabaḥkarib Dhū-Hirrān
Mashkarum Dhū-Gharībam and Dharaʾkarib bin Ḥanẓat and Gayrum Dhū-Shahr and Hawfāʿamm bin
Dhū-Yagirr and ʿAmmīyathaʿ Dhū-Rashīm and Laḥayʿathat Maʿāhir and Ḍabʾum bin Zikhnān and Hawfāʿathat N=
bin Maʿāhir and ʾAbīshibām bin ʾAʿsāyfir and Dhaydum Gharībān and ʿAmmīdhakhar Gulgulān and Hawtarʿathat
Hawfāʿamm Dhū-Haṣbaḥ and ʿAmmīdhakhar Dhū-Shirgān and ʾAbīshafaq Dhū-Harmaw and ʾAbīshafaq bin Giʾnān and Laśib
and Yithāʿkarib Yiʾdhān and Nabaṭʿalī bin Hathib Rishḥum and ʿAmmīkarib bin Ṣabāḥum and Sumūyadaʿ Dhū-Guʿrān
shafaq Dhū-Yāfiʿam and Maʿdʾīl Dhū-Naḍīrān and Nabaṭʿamm bin Ṭawiyyān and Yaʿgif Dhū-Yaʿgif and Dhaydum Dhū-ʿAgidh and ʿA=
Dhū-Hathʿar Laḥay and ʿAmmīʾamīn Khabidhān and Sumūyadaʿ Ṭan.zum and Yinfaʾ Dhū-Rafit and Nabaṭʿamm Dhū-Dharaḥān.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
